Title: Sr. Director, Communications, Product and Technology
RoleDescription:
Peloton is seeking a strategic and highly connected Senior Director of Product Communications to lead the external communications strategy for our growing portfolio of consumer hardware and digital technology products. Reporting directly to the Chief Communications Officer, this individual will serve as the companys communications lead for all product-related announcements, innovation narratives, and milestone moments. This is a high-visibility leadership role that will shape how Peloton's groundbreaking products are perceived in the market - both by consumers and industry influencers.
You will oversee integrated product communications across software, hardware, and digital platforms. You will work closely with executive leadership, including product, design, engineering, marketing, and talent brand to create and execute world-class go-to-market communications strategies. A critical component of this role will be cultivating relationships with top-tier consumer and technology press, think The Verge, WIRED, Fast Company, and TechCrunch, and securing marquee moments and speaking opportunities that place Pelotons innovations and leaders at the forefront of the industry.
You are an exceptional storyteller, experienced in bringing complex technology products to life for broad consumer audiences. You are just as comfortable briefing a top-tier tech journalist as you are preparing a C-level executive for a global product launch. You bring a track record of successfully leading communications for major launches and driving coverage that shapes public perception.
 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Develop and lead global product communications strategy for Pelotons connected fitness, software, and digital product innovations.
Serve as a trusted strategic advisor to executive leadership, particularly across product and engineering, helping shape and articulate the companys innovation story.
Own the media strategy and execution for all product announcements, launches, and innovation milestones - securing impactful coverage that positions Peloton as a category leader.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with top-tier media, influencers, and analysts across consumer tech, innovation, and lifestyle verticals.
Identify and secure high-impact speaking opportunities and industry stages (e.g., CES, SXSW, Wired25) for Peloton executives and technical leaders.
Oversee development of all product comms materials including press releases, talking points, media pitches, blog content, and executive bylines.
Lead agency and vendor partnerships to scale campaign execution, story amplification, and product storytelling.
Collaborate cross-functionally with internal communications, product marketing, investor relations, legal, and brand teams to ensure consistency and alignment across all public messaging.
Monitor industry trends and competitive activity, providing insights and recommendations to leadership.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

10+ years of experience in communications, with significant experience leading product and technology PR in-house or at top-tier agencies; experience launching high-profile consumer tech or hardware products is required.
Strong relationships with leading tech and business media, with a portfolio of impactful placements in outlets like The Verge, WIRED, Fast Company, TechCrunch, Bloomberg, and others.
Proven experience crafting and leading complex, multi-channel launch strategies for consumer technology products.
Exceptional leadership and interpersonal skills, with experience managing high-performing teams and working cross-functionally with senior leaders.
Demonstrated ability to manage complex situations, and deliver results in a fast-paced environment.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills; writing samples required.
Experience working with or within a product or engineering organization is a strong plus.
Bachelor's degree in Communications, Journalism, Marketing, or a related field; advanced degree a plus.

Title: Senior Product Analyst – Strength Engagement
RoleDescription:
About the RolePeloton is looking for a Senior Product Analyst to join our Product Analytics team, focused on Peloton Strength. Youll work cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, Design, and User Research to innovate and improve how members engage with strength training.
As a senior team member, youll operate independentlyowning your roadmap, identifying opportunities, and driving analyses from insight to action.You will convert complex data into clear, strategic recommendationsand use those insights to shape product strategy and business outcomes.
You Will:

Own analytics for Peloton Strength, from defining success metrics to delivering insights that drive product decisions
Design, launch, and measure A/B tests that influence the roadmap
Tell compelling stories with data that guide strategic direction and influence senior stakeholders
Translate member behavior into actionable insights that improve retention and long-term engagement
Apply causal inference techniques (e.g., difference-in-differences, propensity scoring, regression modeling) to evaluate product impact beyond A/B tests
Act as a thought partner to Product leadershipflagging opportunities, challenging assumptions, and shaping strategy
Develop expertise in strength training habits, user personas, and feature adoption

You Bring:

47 years of analytics experience, ideally in product or UX analytics (fitness or consumer tech a plus)
Fluency in SQL and comfort with Python (e.g. pandas, numpy) for data exploration
Experience designing and analyzing A/B tests with statistical rigor
Strong statistical knowledge: hypothesis testing, confidence intervals, regressions, and modeling
Proven ability to work autonomously and drive projects with minimal oversight
Track record of influencing product strategy through data storytelling
Comfort in fast-paced, agile environments
Curiosity, humility, and a user-first mindset

Bonus Points:

Experience with Amplitude, Mixpanel, Segment, or similar tools for analyzing user engagement data
Background in consumer tech, hardware/software products, or mobile-first experience
Experience using large language models (LLMs) for analysis or workflow acceleration

Title: Manager, Consolidation
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for a Manager, Financial Reporting and Consolidations to join our Accounting and Finance team at Peloton! This person will be part of the Financial Reporting and Governance team, and more specifically responsible for our consolidations and internal management reporting processes, including monthly close management, consolidation of subsidiary level general ledgers, monthly variance analysis, and governance over the organizations compliance with various financial statement close processes. This position will report to the Senior Manager, Financial Reporting and Consolidations, will work on multiple projects at once, and be responsible for creating and maintaining effective communication with multiple business partners.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Own monthly consolidation of domestic and international subsidiary general ledgers in accordance with U.S. GAAP and ensure accurate and timely reporting. This includes monitoring status during the close, review of Precor financial information, locking the NetSuite ledger and the preparation of consolidated trial balance
Manage all aspects of global intercompany accounting, including governance framework, billings and allocations, settlements, eliminations, account reconciliations and coordination of transfer pricing with the Tax team
Support the year-end financial statement audit, as well as any statutory audits throughout the year
Prepare monthly variance analysis with insightful comments for senior management review
Develop and maintain close governance policies, SOPs and transaction flows and communicate these to Accounting and FP&A teams
Responsible for the preparation of monthly close KPIs and compliance with close governance policies
Coordinate monthly close calendars with key leaders in the Accounting and FP&A teams, including scheduling of monthly close meetings
Responsible for monitoring and evaluating Pelotons foreign exchange exposure and partner with the Treasury team to implement vital accounting procedures and controls
Responsible for accumulating errors (both corrected out of period and uncorrected) during the quarter and performing quarterly SAB99/108 analysis
Perform continuous assessment of the consolidation close process and implement controls to improve consistency and accuracy of the reported results
Drive process efficiencies and reduction of close timeline by assessing and streamlining close-related activities
Assist special projects, such EPM implementation, ERP enhancements, internal controls, and ad-hoc analyses as requested

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

5+ years of accounting experience, with a mix of private and public accounting experience, more specifically strong experience of global consolidation, intercompany transactions/eliminations, foreign currency translation and remeasurements, multi-currency consolidations 
Active CPA license required
Education or comparable professional experience in Accounting or related field
Outstanding problem-solving skills and ability to balance multiple priorities and timelines
Prior experience with NetSuite and SAP ERPs
The ability to take initiative to identify, prioritize and implement all elements required for the team to fulfill responsibilities in accordance with core strategic goals
Strong problem-solving skills, including the ability to effectively address any issue in collaboration with others as appropriate, and proactively identify and prevent potential problems
Proven ability to leverage current technology to drive process efficiencies
Must be highly organized, detail-oriented, self-starter with the ability to work independently and within a team environment
Exceptional written and oral communication, teamwork orientation and diplomacy
Performs well under pressure and effectively balance multiple, concurrent demands and appropriately prioritize responsibilities
Ability to work as a team player in a fast paced and dynamic environment
Ability to disaggregate, analyze and reconcile consolidated financial data in an accurate and timely manner
Experience working with Microsoft Office Suite; Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
Strong understanding of internal control concepts, including documentation requirements
Possess an ownership mentality

Title: Sr. Tooling Engineer
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Senior Tooling Engineer is a crucial position for optimizing the tooling development from tooling design to production sustaining with JDMs (Joint Development Manufacturer), ODMs (Original Design Manufacturer) and CMs (Contract Manufacturers) with consideration in both throughput and quality, while also advice on optimizing part & assembly design for manufacturing (DFM) with internal design and engineering team. An ideal candidate should have hands-on experiences with hydroforming tooling, metallic tooling and process design and/or tool trial trouble shooting on site. Experienced with injection toolings, overmolding techniques, rubber forming, progressive dies, stage dies, transfer dies, tool steel selection, deep draw, high speed stamping, forging, surface coating, surface finish processing and heat treating are important traits of an ideal candidate as well.
To ensure the quality delivery of the program, the Senior Tooling Engineer is responsible for several key tasks. These include drafting supplier-facing tooling requirements and maintenance plans, which will be based on both product demand and design specifications. The engineer will also gather tooling information to populate company asset databases. Furthermore, the role involves active participation in tool trial activities and conducting supplier capability studies to guarantee tool quality. To support the company's long-term growth, the Tooling Engineer will be responsible for developing a knowledge library for advanced materials and fabrication, contributing tooling input for product design requirements, and building simulation models for tooling and part cost analysis.
The Senior Tooling Engineer will not only provide day-to-day technical support for internal teams and JDMs/ODMs/CMs, including engineering changes implementation on tooling, part availability tracking and schedule discussion and cost reduction but also continuous improvement in both quality and time, hands-on implementation of the improvements in the production lines for ensuring manufacturing activities. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Collaborate with cross-functional engineering teams to ensure robust DFM/DFA, providing expertise in material & process selection, tooling design and material requirement, process audit and tooling qualification plan

They will partner cross-functionally with the entire Global Sales Solutions team and with teams across Sales, Supply Chain, Member Support, Finance, Enterprise Tech, and more and will regularly communicate program updates and implications to these global stakeholders.  They will also be required to build and maintain relationships with external partners and vendors and ensure they uphold their contractual obligations and our standards of excellence. 
 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON


Sales Operations: Execute the day-to-day management of Peloton sales operations in Germany/Austria, including but not limited to partner onboarding, activation support & management, external vendor management (agencies) & compliance, asset deployment, and budget management. 


Retail Activation: Identifies and recommends retail activation opportunities. Project manages and leads physical retail activations. Manages and directs the sales components of marketing and partnership activations, ensuring they align with overall business objectives.


Process Optimization: Identifying and implementing strategies to streamline processes, reduce inefficiencies, and improve overall operational efficiency. Develop and implement Sales Policies and Procedure (SOPs, documentation) when required. 


Strong Business Acumen:  Ongoing review of business reports and participation in regular business reviews with international sales leadership to build a deep understanding of the business and identify opportunities to improve sales operational excellence. Act as a point person for operational questions, issues, and ideation.

Make sure that customers' orders are placed on time, reflected in the systems (internal and external), and delivered according to business requirements.


Data Analysis & Performance: Analyze operational data to identify trends, track performance, and generate reports, on a monthly and quarterly basis to inform decision-making.




Relationship Management: Effectively communicate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders, both internally and externally, ultimately building strong relationships and fostering collaboration.

4+ years of relevant operational work experience in a B2C and/or B2B sales environment, preferably supporting  global teams

Self-motivated and driven individual who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment


Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines


Ability to work well with stakeholders and small, agile teams


Experience developing & managing budgets 


Highly organized and thorough work ethic


Understanding of Pelotons company vision and brand image with the ability to communicate it effectively and with enthusiasm


Excellent written and editing skills


Software proficiency in relevant sales software including but not limited to: CRM platforms, such as Salesforce, customer success platforms, Looker, and project management tools.


Ability to travel as needed

Fluent German and English required

Title: Localisation Project Manager
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Pelotons Content Department, comprising our Production, Studio Operations and Instructor teams, works 365 days a year to deliver a broad offering of highly-engaging subscription content to our members. We are a highly collaborative, fast-moving department that focuses on evolving our innovative programming. 
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Localisation Project Manager to support our localisation efforts, ensuring the highest quality and cultural relevance of our content for international markets. This role will be pivotal in shaping our localisation strategy, optimising AI-first workflows, managing vendor relationships, and critically, evaluating the performance of AI models specifically used for subtitling. The ideal candidate will possess a strong blend of linguistic expertise, project management skills, and a keen understanding of AI's application in the localisation landscape.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Oversee the end-to-end localisation lifecycle, liaise with Pelotons localisation partners, and ensure the timely and right-first-time delivery of high-quality localised content to Members. 
Manage multiple localisation projects concurrently, prioritising tasks and mitigating risks.
Implement and optimise localisation workflows, leveraging industry best practices and technology.
Recruit, train and manage high-performing freelance Linguists to support QC efforts.
Organise the evaluation of translation output from Machine Translation and other AI technologies, and provide feedback to Engineering teams.
Create, maintain and expand language assets, including glossaries, guides and playbooks, and contribute to the establishment of cross-functional localisation best practices.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders, providing expertise and support, and communicating clearly on day-to-day operational activities.
Monitor the Member Support channels and resolve any captioning or localisation issues.
Monitor the relevant localisation performance data boards and report on the health status of captioning and localisation operations.
Liaise with our translation technology partners, suggest new features, resolve issues, and ensure smooth operation of the service.
Select, onboard, and manage external localisation vendors (LSPs, freelance linguists) to ensure consistent quality and performance.

The ideal candidate will be organised, prepared, and skilled at executing tasks while providing outstanding customer service. This individual will serve as a leader and role model for all team members, ensuring every member's experience at Peloton Studios is consistently excellent from start to finish.
Full-time position
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Serve as a lead and role model for all full- and part-time hourly team members.

Title: Sr. Manager, Team Member Relations
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Were seeking a dynamic, highly organized, and proactive Senior Manager of Team Member Relations to join our People team at Pelotons New York headquarters. In this critical role, you'll report to the Sr. Director, Team Member Relations and partner closely with People Business Partners, Employment Counsel, and business leaders. You'll be instrumental in upholding Peloton's core values by ensuring fair and respectful treatment of all team members.
You'll contribute significantly to the evolution of our proactive employee relations framework, focusing on risk mitigation through training, early conflict resolution, and data-driven insights. This role involves directly managing the investigation, documentation, and resolution of team member grievances, providing expert guidance on performance management, developing key training programs, and offering specialized employee relations consultation. You'll also be responsible for managing ADA accommodations, which includes being the central point of contact for team members requesting reasonable accommodations due to a disability, engaging in interactive dialogues with team members and managers, and meticulously documenting all aspects of the process. 
We're looking for someone who demonstrates exceptional judgment, balances objectivity with empathy, and excels in collaborative cross-functional partnerships and stakeholder management. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Serve as a trusted employee relations expert, skillfully navigating sensitive HR escalations while ensuring compliance with applicable employment laws, regulations, and company policies.
Actively listen and connect with team members at all levels, ensuring they feel safe, heard, and respected. 
Conduct thorough, professional, and efficient investigations to gather critical facts, enabling sound and equitable decision-making.
Independently manage and prioritize an investigation caseload, balancing proper documentation, comprehensive interviews, stakeholder communication, concise report writing, effective coaching, and timely resolution.
Provide briefings and practical recommendations to leaders and key stakeholders.
Leverage our case-management system to document findings, evidence, and investigation reports in a fact-based, concise, and timely manner.
Capably navigate challenging and sensitive situations, ensuring all matters are handled with objectivity, consistency, and a commitment to fairness.
Synthesize and analyze data, trends, and opportunities from various internal systems to facilitate proactive risk mitigation, early issue resolution, and improve organizational health.
Partner effectively and collaboratively with business leaders and People Business Partners across the organization to implement systemic solutions and foster positive employee relations.
Develop and deliver impactful employee relations training programs for team members and people leaders.
Provide expert guidance, education, and coaching to people leaders on employee relations best practices and effective communication techniques.
Manage complex ADA accommodations, engaging in interactive dialogues with team members, managers, and other stakeholders to determine appropriate courses of action based on nuanced considerations, including undue hardship and essential job functions.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

5+ years of progressive HR experience, with a strong emphasis on employee relations, investigations, employment law, HR policy, and training and development. 
Deep knowledge and practical experience interpreting and communicating employment policies, practices, and employment law and regulations with confidence.
Demonstrated experience conducting investigatory interviews involving complex, sensitive, and confidential topics. 
Exceptional mediation, deescalation, and conflict resolution skills that demonstrate active listening, flexibility, and effective communication.
Acute attention to detail, coupled with effective prioritization and ownership.
Proven ability to balance quality of work with meeting Service Level Agreements (SLAs) in a fast-paced environment.
Strength in managing competing priorities simultaneously and focusing on the highest impact work. 
Strong analytical and systems thinking, leveraging data-driven insights combined with sound decision-making to address complex challenges effectively.
Ability to effectively convey complex information through clear and concise writing.
Adept at working effectively across multiple functions and roles within a complex organization.
Excellent communication and presentation skills that foster strong partnerships and collaboration across all management levels and functional areas (including HR, Legal business / function heads).
Unwavering ability to handle highly confidential information with maturity, discretion and professionalism. 
Experience handling ER matters with a diverse population, including both hourly and corporate employees is a plus.

Title: Sr. Manager, Payroll
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE As the Senior Manager, Global Payroll, you'll be the cornerstone of our payroll operations, responsible for the accurate, compliant, and timely processing of payroll for our domestic and international employee base. This role will report to the VP, Finance Transformation & Technology and is based at our headquarters in New York City. You'll be a strategic leader in driving continuous improvement, leveraging technology, and establishing best practices across our global payroll ecosystem. This highly visible role serves as the primary subject matter expert and escalation point for all payroll-related matters, demanding exceptional attention to detail, proactive problem-solving, and a commitment to providing outstanding service to our employees and internal stakeholders.
YOUR IMPACT AT PELOTON

Strategic Oversight & Operations: Oversee and optimize the accurate and timely processing of all domestic and international payrolls (bi-weekly, weekly, monthly, off-cycle) for a fast-paced global organization.
Compliance & Risk Management: Ensure strict adherence to all internal company policies, SOX requirements, and country-specific, federal, and state regulations, including wage and hour laws and taxation. Proactively identify, track, and resolve potential payroll-related issues and risks, escalating complex matters to senior management as needed.
Process Excellence & Automation: Lead initiatives to identify, develop, and implement process standardization, automation, and continuous improvements across global payroll operations, driving efficiency and scalability to support the companys continued evolution.
Cross-Functional Partnership: Act as the primary payroll liaison, collaborating closely with Accounting (for GL reporting and reconciliations), People Systems, Legal, and other internal partners to establish and maintain best practices for global payroll.
Systems & Integrations: Drive the project management for global payroll service implementations, system integrations (e.g., HRIS, time & attendance, equity platforms), and other related technology initiatives.
Reporting & Analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis, generate comprehensive payroll reports, and provide data-driven insights to support decision-making for the People and Finance teams on special projects aimed at streamlining processes and improving procedures.
Subject Matter Expertise & Escalation: Serve as the primary point of escalation and subject matter expert for all complex payroll inquiries, tax processing questions, and policy matters, providing timely and accurate resolutions.

WHAT YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Experience: 10+ years of progressive, hands-on payroll experience, with a strong emphasis on managing global payroll operations for multi-country organizations.
Technical Expertise:

Deep and current knowledge of U.S. federal, state, and local payroll tax laws and regulations (including multi-state).
Extensive understanding of international payroll complexities, statutory requirements, and best practices.
Profound understanding of stock/equity compensation taxation, reporting, and disbursement.
Solid grasp of payroll accounting principles and general ledger reconciliation.

Systems Acumen: Demonstrated expertise with ADP payroll systems (including large enterprise modules like ADP WorkForce Now, GlobalView, or Celergo) and a proven track record of successful payroll system implementations, upgrades, and integrations.
Process Improvement Mindset: Proven ability to identify inefficiencies, drive process standardization, and implement automated solutions to enhance payroll accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.
Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills: Exceptional analytical capabilities with a keen eye for detail, coupled with strong problem-solving skills to navigate complex payroll scenarios and discrepancies.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders across all levels and functions in a global environment.
Resilience & Adaptability: Ability to thrive and deliver outstanding results in a dynamic, high-pressure, and fast-paced environment, demonstrating strong organizational and time management skills.

Proactive & Independent: Self-motivated, proactive, and capable of operating independently while also being a strong team player with a desire to contribute to collective success.

Title: Product Safety and Compliance Engineer
RoleDescription:
Overview:We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Product Compliance Engineer to join our Product Safety and Compliance team. This individual will be based in Taichung and report to Sr. Director, Product Safety and Technical Compliance, working cross-functionally with various teams, including Product, Design, Engineering, and Operations teams to ensure that all products are safe, legally compliant, and certification-ready for global markets. Key Responsibilities:

Partner with cross-functional teams to interpret and apply global regulatory requirements related to performance, materials, packaging, and mechanical/electrical safety.
Drive the creation and execution of test and certification plans for new product introductions and sustaining changes.
Develop pre-certification test strategies to proactively identify and resolve compliance issues early in the development cycle.
Establish and maintain comprehensive technical documentation packages; conduct periodic audits and updates.
Collaborate with internal teams, suppliers and third-party labs to debug and implement compliant solutions during development and testing.
Define and implement manufacturing audit protocols to ensure continued regulatory compliance in mass production.
Build and manage relationships with certification bodies (e.g., UL, TV, Intertek, SGS) to scope, schedule, and manage testing programs.
Review and analyze test reports from labs and suppliers; ensure corrective actions are taken where needed.
Standardize and improve compliance processes across product development and change management workflows.
Serve as the internal subject matter expert on product compliance and safetyensuring clear, digestible communication of technical requirements to internal stakeholders.
Monitor evolving global regulations and translate relevant updates into actionable guidance for internal teams.
Actively participate in design reviews and change control boards to ensure compliance and safety are addressed throughout the product lifecycle.
Actively participate in on-site product builds as well as supplier qualification audits as needed.

Qualifications:
Required:

Must have Mechanical Engineering or Electrical Engineering degree
Must have previous global product certification experience 
Experience working in fitness, Electrical Consumer Products and/or Consumer electronics, or other related fields 
Familiar with ASTM, EN, ISO Mechanical Safety standards as well as FCC, IC, and EN EMC testing,. 
Familiar with Global Chemical compliance regulations such as REACH, RoHS, Prop65, TSCA and chemical testing 
Strong data analytics and technical documentation skills
Strong communication and organization skills with the ability to clearly and concisely provide updates to cross-functional teams
Able to prioritize and balance multiple projects/deliverables while remaining focused on attention to detail
Someone who thrives in a fast-paced, self-starter dynamic environment while fostering collaboration. 
Requires frequent domestic travel (up to 30%)

Preferred:

Experience with UL817, IEC60335 series standards, ISO/EN 20957 series standards as well as ASTM Fitness equipment standards
Hands-on experience in product design or at a certification agency
Knowledge of Wi-Fi certification programs and wireless testing requirements
Established relationships with certification bodies such as UL, TV, or Intertek

Title: Procurement Engineer (Global Supply Chain Manager)
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
 
The Procurement Engineer drives strategic cost management for select Peloton products and accessories, ensuring adherence to target costs throughout their lifecycles using a bottoms-up approach. Key responsibilities include managing the total cost of ownership (TCO), optimizing the supply chain network, and supporting product development through SPOR and dual-sourcing initiatives. Additional duties encompass complexity reduction, component phase-in/phase-out planning, and end-to-end supplier process improvements. The role also involves capital expenditure (CapEx) budget oversight and statement of work (SOW) management.
 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON


Enhance product cost competitiveness throughout the product lifecycle by optimizing total cost of ownership (TCO).


Collaborate with suppliers and engineering teams on value engineering, including:


Competitive teardowns and reverse engineering.


Should-cost and clean-sheet cost modeling.


Concept scoping and feature tradeoff analysis




Ensure product cost efficiency, supply chain scalability, and flexibility by:


Providing feature-value tradeoff recommendations.


Optimizing TCO across components and products.


Conducting value-stream mapping to reduce supply chain lead times, costs, and enhance network flexibility.




Supports the development of value engineering, cost engineering, and DfX certification programs to educate & train product development personnel with Peloton to develop & sustain products from a total cost of ownership (TCO) perspective.


Oversee cost engineering activities to align bottoms-up cost estimates with target product costs, maximizing TCO.


Manage the Supplier Plan of Record (SPOR), ensuring components are sourced on time, within budget, and to specifications through commodity management and JDM/ODM partnerships.


Control capital expenditure (CapEx) during New Product Introduction (NPI) to achieve cost-competitive outcomes.

Portfolio requiredplease include a live link or downloadable PDF showcasing your user-centered design work, interaction design skills, and problem-solving approach.

Capture all states, edge-cases, unhappy paths and path logic for engineering teams to build out

Execute UI from exploration/concept to final pixel perfect hand-off to engineering
QA developed software for visual accuracy, and provide detailed feedback to engineering towards revisions until product launch

Comfortable working with ambiguous requirements and ability to quickly adapt and flex on direction of projects
Proven record of bringing features to life from conception to production in a compressed time frame
Highly attentive to detail and ability to conceptualize multi-state, multi-path interaction systems and to consistently capture edge-cases
Exceptional design velocity: ability and willingness to quickly produce multiple concepts.
Excellent communication and organizational skills
Iterative approach to product design, ensuring a unified experience across the board
Cognitive awareness of wider business goals, delivering intuitive and user-centered design solutions
Focused and dedicated to how software products function and how users move through the experience to accomplish their goals
Experience working closely with product, analytics, user research and engineers to develop and iterate on interactive software experiences
Experience designing for a variety of screen sizes and platforms: for fully responsive web experiences and/or for mobile (touch-device) apps

RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for a curious and detail-oriented Data Scientist to join our Ecommerce Product Analytics team. In this role, you will support data-driven decision-making by analyzing user behavior, and contributing to A/B test design and interpretation. Your insights will help improve user experience, conversion rates, and overall e-commerce performance. You will work closely with product managers, and cross-functional teams to uncover meaningful patterns in data and turn them into actionable recommendations.This is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Director of Product Analytics, with opportunities to expand technical depth and grow into a more strategic or managerial path over time.

Analytical Execution & Insights

Conduct analysis of web and behavioral data to support key initiatives across traffic, engagement, and conversion

Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to define and measure success metrics

Partner with product managers and business stakeholders to clarify goals and turn them into measurable questions
Work closely with other data teams and data engineers to ensure high-quality instrumentation and data access
Surface data quality issues or gaps in tracking and propose improvements collaboratively

Assist in maintaining and refining experimentation workflows and documentation

Contribute to written summaries and presentations that connect data insights to business outcomes
Participate in team meetings and brainstorming sessions, offering ideas and contributing to a culture of learning

Understanding of A/B testing principles and statistical significance

Clear communicator who can explain data insights to non-technical audiences
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, cross-functional environment
Eagerness to learn and grow within a high-impact analytics team

Prior experience working on ecommerce, digital product, or user engagement analytics
Exposure to marketing metrics, attribution, or customer segmentation

ABOUT THE ROLE:
Peloton is looking for a motivated, dynamic attorney with 7+ years of experience at a top law firm or in-house legal department to join our corporate legal team. As Senior Counsel, you will be primarily responsible for supporting Pelotons senior attorneys, Finance and People teams on all matters related to our public filings, securities law compliance, capital markets transactions, investor relations and Board and committee matters. 
 This role requires a strong understanding of Pelotons multifaceted business, including relationships with key stakeholders such as our members, suppliers, and partners, to help achieve our business objectives. This role will be based out of our New York City headquarters office and will be required to comply with our hybrid policy. Currently, hybrid team members report to the office weekly on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday.
 
YOUR IMPACT AT PELOTON:

Serve as the main legal contact for the Financial Reporting team in preparing and reviewing SEC filings (Form 10-K, 10-Q). 
Lead preparation and analysis of proxy statements, Form 8-K, related party transactions, director and officer questionnaires, and corporate compliance calendars.
Oversee administration of Pelotons Insider Trading Policy and 10b5-1 plans, and prepare reports of beneficial ownership for officers and directors on Forms 3, 4 and 5. 
Review external communications, including press releases, investor presentations, and other announcements in collaboration with Investor Relations and Communications teams.

Title: Manager, SOX and Risk Assurance
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for a highly-motivated leader to join our growing SOX & Risk Assurance team, working primarily with our Precor business unit. This role will be responsible for operating as the Second Line of Defense within the Accounting Organization, establishing and maintaining policies and procedures that help monitor and enhance the companys global control environment and support management (First Line) in the identification of emerging risks. The SOX Manager will be a trusted business partner helping to design and optimize business processes and controls, while also operating as the primary liaison with internal audit (Third Line) and our external auditors on SOX compliance. The ideal candidate has a detailed knowledge of SOX and COSO framework, strong business process acumen, excellent communication and critical thinking skills, and an ability to collaborate effectively across a range of internal and external partners. This role offers a great opportunity to learn and grow within a high energy and innovative organization.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Work within the Second Line of Defense (SOX) team, acting as an advisor to the business and driving the design, implementation and monitoring of Peloton's risk and control framework
Lead and manage all aspects of SOX work for a newly implemented and maturing SOX program for the Precor business with a sense of urgency - from planning, design, testing, reporting and remediation.
Develop and maintain/update process documentation, procedures and controls, including flowcharts and Risk and Control Matrices; document narratives as vital.
Conduct process walkthroughs and risk assessments, evaluating design effectiveness of key business process controls; if deficiencies are identified, partner with management to design appropriate remediation plans with feasible timelines and monitor remediation to completion.
Provide guidance and support to control owners if they propose process or system changes (e.g.implementation of new systems, impact assessment for changes in people, process or technology).
Provide timely and proactive updates to the SOX & Finance leadership team on key risks, gaps, process enhancements, or any areas of potential concern.
Prepare and provide regular training on SOX and control requirements, risk management, and other relevant areas (e.g. management review controls, IPE procedures, etc.) to educate business process owners and reiterate the importance of compliance
Partner with the IT SOX team to ensure alignment on SOX approach, timing, controls reliance, external audit reliance, etc.
Provide creative input that will drive process efficiency across the organization and make valuable contributions to the audit process.
Establish and maintain excellent relationships within the team and cross-functional teams.
Find opportunities to leverage IT solutions to automate processes and create efficiencies in financial processes and strengthen internal controls.
Coordinate activities and strategies with internal and external auditors.
Participate in the preparation of leadership and Audit Committee materials.
Perform other related special studies or projects as assigned, meeting deadlines.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

BA/BS degree in Accounting/Finance or related field. CPA, CIA, or CISA preferred.
5+ years of relevant Internal Audit or SOX experience
Mix of private and public accounting experience (assurance or advisory) at a Big 4 or national public accounting firm.
Strong business process acumen and knowledge of standard processes and best practice, with direct experience with Order-to-Cash, Procure-to-Pay, Inventory and Financial Statement Close processes.
Working knowledge of IT systems - SAP, Salesforce, home grown systems, etc. and data analytics tools.
Highly organized, motivated, meticulous with the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Flexible and able to adapt quickly in a fast-moving environment; able to easily manage competing priorities and deadlines.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think critically to find solutions that meet compliance requirements while supporting business operations and objectives

Title: Treasury Associate
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Peloton Treasury Team is looking for a talented treasury professional to join our team! The ideal candidate is a self-starter, analytical, attentive to detail, and highly organized. Moreover, the candidate is someone who consistently exceeds expectations and excels in quantitative and qualitative analytics. Having a solid foundation in Treasury and an interest in capital markets and macroeconomic trends is a plus. The Associate will support Pelotons banking activities, liquidity management and analytics, capital market reporting, maintenance of procedures, and support ad-hoc Treasury projects. Collaborate internally and externally to ensure timely and accurate processing of Treasury payments, including wires and ACH, FX, and credit card activity.

Support ad-hoc projects and reporting for insurance, T&E, and consumer finance workstreams.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON:

Bachelors Degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or related field.
2-3 years relevant Treasury or finance experience.
Understanding of cash management, payment processes, and Treasury systems.
Experience with Excel (vlookups, pivot tables, conditional formatting).
Excellent analytical skills and ability to identify areas to improve processes.
Strong problem solving and decision-making skills with an analytical mindset.
Experience with FX and investment management concepts.
Familiarity with treasury management systems and ERP experience (Kyriba, Netsuite, etc.)
Familiarity with and interest in capital markets and macroeconomic analysis.
Demonstrated ability to successfully manage multiple workstreams simultaneously.

Title: Sr. Operations Program Manager
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Operations Program Manager (OPM) will be a key operations interface in partnership to other OPMs, Supply Chain teams, manufacturing & quality teams, and other functional organizations within Peloton. It is the responsibility of the OPM to manage programs from the Production phase through End of Life.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Assess, consolidate, and communicate risk and status clearly, calling out key issues and presenting options for resolution to the cross-functional executive team through program reviews and other executive forums.
Drive decision making and collaboration across different teams, prioritizing and driving execution of programs in different phases.
Create project plans, identify constraints and risks, and provide mitigation plans for multiple complex programs within manufacturing operations, working closely with supply chain teams to deliver project goals.
Coordinate with manufacturing, quality, and engineering teams to develop product improvement strategies to drive successful cost-down initiatives
Act as the point of contact from the factory operations teams to US-based Operations, Engineering, and Quality teams from development phase through end of life.
Liaison across multiple cross-functional teams to ensure product cost, manufacturability, reliability, product quality, and safety and compliance strategies are met.
Ability to manage high-level executive communications for senior leadership updates and program review.
Lead and execute on multiple analysis on line capacity and ramp plans for new products and sustaining changes.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

BS or higher in Supply Chain Management, Manufacturing & Operations Engineering or equivalent experience.
Strong experience leading cross functional teams, including managing Sustaining and Development projects with peers and leadership in the USA.
8+ years of experience in Technical Operations, Manufacturing and Program Management/NPI role in consumer electronics, appliances, automotive or equivalent fast paced industry.
Experience working with program management tools such as, Jira, Confluence, Smartsheets, Google Drive.
Experience in the identification, assessment, and management of risks; able to handle and drive resolution of the risks, not just maintaining the risk register.
Experience working with and managing external suppliers and manufacturers.
Good interpersonal communication, problem-solving, negotiation, and organizational skills.
Self-starter/self-motivated, capable of staying on track and pursuing solutions without supervision.
